findings.title:
Credential in plaintext?

Rule: Env Var
Line: EMAIL_HOST_PASSWORD = os.environ.get("EMAIL_PASSWORD")

Commit: .
findings.description:
The application stores sensitive information in cleartext within a resource that might be accessible to another control sphere.

## Additional information

**[Env Var](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/312.html)**

findings.title: Security Misconfiguration with the config `EMAIL_USE_TLS` set to a static value `True`.
findings.description:
Django application is not configured correctly for deployment to production and live environments. Default settings that are more appropriate for development environment are in use.

## Additional information

**[OWASP-A6](https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/OWASP_Top_Ten_2017/Top_10-2017_A6-Security_Misconfiguration)**

**[Django Security](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.1/topics/security/)**

**[Deployment Checklist](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/howto/deployment/checklist/)**

details.name: Security Misconfiguration with the config `EMAIL_USE_TLS` set to a static value `True`.
details.snippetText:
EMAIL_HOST_PASSWORD = os.environ.get("CONFIG_EMAIL_HOST_PASSWORD")
EMAIL_USE_TLS = True
EMAIL_PORT = 587
# django configs

findings.title: Security Misconfiguration with the config `SECRET_KEY` set to a static value `None`.
findings.description:
Django application is not configured correctly for deployment to production and live environments. Default settings that are more appropriate for development environment are in use.

## Additional information

**[OWASP-A6](https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/OWASP_Top_Ten_2017/Top_10-2017_A6-Security_Misconfiguration)**

**[Django Security](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.1/topics/security/)**

**[Deployment Checklist](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/howto/deployment/checklist/)**

details.name: Security Misconfiguration with the config `SECRET_KEY` set to a static value `None`.
details.snippetText:
# django configs
SECRET_KEY = str(os.environ.get("CONFIG_SECRET_KEY"))
DEBUG = bool(int(os.environ.get("CONFIG_DEBUG", 0)))
ALLOWED_HOSTS = os.environ.get("CONFIG_ALLOWED_HOSTS", []).split(", ")

findings.title: Consider including CSRF protection middleware for django applications.
findings.description:
Django Security Middleware allows you to quickly add common security mechanisms to your Django application

## Additional information

**[OWASP-A6](https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/OWASP_Top_Ten_2017/Top_10-2017_A6-Security_Misconfiguration)**

**[Django Security](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.1/topics/security/)**

**[Django Security Middleware](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/middleware/#django.middleware.security.SecurityMiddleware)**

**[Clickjacking Protection](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/clickjacking/)**

details.name: Consider including CSRF protection middleware for django applications.
details.snippetText:
MIDDLEWARE = [
    'django.middleware.security.SecurityMiddleware',
    'corsheaders.middleware.CorsMiddleware',
